alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Dolores, or 43 miles northwest of Durango, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
